required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 01, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Crossover Bioequivalence Study of Oxcarbazepine 600 mg Suspension Under Fed Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose, Two-Period, Two-Treatment, Two-Sequence Crossover Bioequivalence Study of Oxcarbazepine 600 mg Suspension Under Fed Conditions

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to prove the bioequivalence of Roxane Laboratories' Oxcarbazepine Suspension 600 mg under fed conditions

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: bioequivalence determined by statistical comparison Cmax
primary_outcome.description: Blood sampling taken during specified time points to determine bioequivalence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No clinically significant abnormal findings on the physical examination, medical history, or clinical laboratory results during screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive test for HIV, Hepatitis B, or Hepatitis C.
- Treatment with known enzyme altering drugs.
- History of allergic or adverse response to oxcarbazepine or any comparable or similar product.

overall_official.affiliation: Worldwide Clinical Trials Drug Development Solutions (formerly CEDRA Clinical Research)

facility.name: Worldwide Clinical Trials Drug Development Solutions (formerly CEDRA Clinical Research)
